I am a public interest technologist specializing in #infosec, #privacy, #competition and #innovation. I help organizations and leaders gain clarity and understanding on complex architecture, information security, privacy practices, and market dynamics, so they can enable secure, trustworthy digital services.

I make a clear distinction between who I am and what I do to earn a living, while seeking to live by a consistent set of personal values.

If you are reading an opinion I posted here, I assure you it's mine and does not necessarily represent the views of anyone else, especially my past and present employer(s). If you misconstrue anything that I say here as any type of official or organizational position (which it absolutely is not), that would be ... silly!

What I post here is a snapshot in time, and I reserve the right to change my opinions!

Am i a #programmer? Am i a #pentester? Am i an #Artist? Am i a #DevOps engineer? Am I a #ML researcher? Am i human?

I was nothing a few decades ago and i will be nothing a few decades after.

But i am a small part of this universe and making my small contribution to the universe.

Hi, i'm Tricia. She/Her. I like to say I'm a marketer who identifies as infosec.‚Ä©Work life: I'm a technical writer in security research. I work with security research all day, every day. Any and everything from malware analysis to IPv6 and in between. Can confirm it is in fact, always DNS.‚Ä©I work with security researchers to help tell their story in an effective way without degrading their technical acumen. It's a lot harder than it sounds, trust me. ‚Ä©Real life: I have a theatre degree and am pretty much always singing. I have a Pomsky named Darth who i love to take pictures and videos of and put online. I am obsessed with true crime and jigsaw puzzles and occasionally do standup comedy.‚Ä®Cross between real and work life: I occasionally write, record, and produce infosec parody songs.‚Ä©Be kind, love yourself, and keep kicking ass.

I'm a #hacker. Question my use of that term? Well I have been in the truest sense of that term since I was a young kid. I'm also a #CISO, 25+ years in tech have been good to me overall. I serve on multiple boards as well, back to that whole "tech has treated me well thing". I'm fortunate to be an Internationally recognized Public #Speaker and the Author of "Cyber Security Career Guide". I do my level best to give back to this community.

I'm also a #pilot and love #aviation. I live in the northern Midwest of the US so if I want good #BBQ I gotta make it myself, and that's just what I do.

If you're reading an opinion I posted I assure you it's mine and does not reflect the views of my employer or any organizations I'm affiliated with.

My pronouns are she/her, and if my listing that bothers you, GTFOH right now.
